attributes.action: save Glastonbury Court EMI Unit from closure.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Elderly Mentally Infirm (EMI) Unit at Glastonbury Court in Bury St Edmunds is a shining example of innovative care for the elderly who suffer from Dementia, Alzheimers, and other challenging conditions. This specialist unit excels because it combines the expertise of 6 qualified mental health nurses who work in partnership with Social Services employed care workers. The combination has provided a loving, safe, caring, and comfortable home for vulnerable members of society who can no longer care for themselves. Suffolk CC intends to close the unit in October –with roughly 11 weeks’ notice- and ‘place’ the 19 residents elsewhere; a disturbance that may be their death sentence.  And why? – could it be because of a pending review of all Suffolk Care Homes? Is it better to rid the system of a one-off and undoubtedly difficult unit first, thus making the remaining package of homes more attractive to sell? Glastonbury Court is a success story and example for the future, which should be duplicated not shut - will this happen near you soon?
